data.fullContent: After graduating from high school, Jill faced a tough decision. She had to choose which college she would attend. Surprisingly, her parents wouldn't help her decide. They wanted her to make her own choice. She knew it was difficult. She wanted to go far away, but she also wanted to stay close to home. She had a lot of friends here. Finally she decided on a university far away but with an excellent reputation. She knew it would be hard to leave her friends and family behind, but she needed a fresh start and thought it was a good thing. It made her feel better to make her own decisions rather than be told what to do for a change.

q1.translation: 高中毕业后，吉尔面临着一个艰难的决定。她必须选择上哪所大学。令人惊讶的是，她的父母不愿帮她做决定。他们想让她自己做选择。她知道这很困难。

options.sentence: Jill knew that she wanted to be a doctor when she was a teenager, but she didn't have the idea of becoming a teacher until later.
Jill's parents wouldn't help her decide, so she decided on a university that was far away but had an excellent reputation.
